pr_title: Make the addition of client metrics heartbeats asynchronous

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to report client metrics at all from the master?
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it makes sense to not report client metrics at all from the master. If not reporting, we may lose some of the client metrics, but client metrics in the master process is wrong no matter what. This is because of the client metrics in master may record as Master.Client.metricName which will not be reported. Will add a TODO to solve master client metrics in the future.
replies.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand why this would take longer if the process is the master. Is there some kind of race condition?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: I think that we shouldn't make the master startup depend upon having Alluxio clients available. If anything, I think this should be a change that we make on the catalog and WebServer side to make sure that a client doesn't need to connect before the RPC server starts?
replies.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: It seems out of place to start the metric system in the heartbeat.
timeline.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: Is it necessary to start the metrics system asynchronously? Only the heartbeat needs the master address right? Instead of computing master address, could we compute it lazily during the heartbeat call (and thus use the heartbeat thread, making the submission of the heartbeat thread lightweight)?
timeline.author: calvinjia

timeline.bodyText: 10 seconds seems like a long shutdown timeout to me. For metrics, I would prefer it to have as little impact as possible on the shutdown of the JVM. Maybe 2-3 seconds is better?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.message: Put the getPrimaryRpc and loadConf logics into the ClientMasterSync heartbeat thread
Put the getPrimaryRpc and loadConf logics into the ClientMasterSync heartbeat thread

timeline.bodyText: Should we still create mMasterClient when we fail above? Since heartbeat will be called periodically, it might be easier to just no-op this heartbeat and try again next time?
timeline.author: calvinjia

replies.bodyText: Make sense, now retry load conf if fail and make heartbeat no-op if load conf failed
replies.author: LuQQiu

timeline.message: If loadConf failed, no heartbeat will be triggered
